docs.lead_paragraph: The bride is a candidate for two graduate degrees at Penn. The groom works for a science and technology services contractor in Laurel, Md.
docs.snippet: The bride is a candidate for two graduate degrees at Penn. The groom works for a science and technology services contractor in Laurel, Md.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas legislators say Republicans have an incentive to reach an agreement on expanding the state’s Medicaid program, the central tenet of federal health reform, because otherwise it would cost the state much more.

headline.seo: Texas Democrats Expect Deal on Medicaid Despite Perry
headline.main: Democrats Expect a Deal on Medicaid Despite Perry
headline.print_headline: Democrats Expect a Deal On Medicaid Despite Perry

docs.snippet: Texas legislators say Republicans have an incentive to reach an agreement on expanding the state’s Medicaid program, the central tenet of federal health reform, because otherwise it would cost the state much more.

docs.lead_paragraph: How much will my medication cost me next year? Does anybody know?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Frank Lalli, former editor at Time Warner's Time Inc, describes his attempts to determine how much he will be required to pay for his blood cancer medication; questions how most people will pick right health insurance plan if seasoned business journalist cannot get straight answer about his medication.
docs.snippet: How much will my medication cost me next year? Does anybody know?

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Friday that it would charge insurance companies for selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government.

headline.seo: Health Insurers Will Be Charged to Use New Exchanges
headline.main: Health Insurers Will Be Charged to Use New Exchanges
headline.print_headline: For Insurers, Exchanges Can Be Used For a Fee

docs.abstract: Obama administration says that it will charge insurance companies for privilege of selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government; in separate action, federal officials announce consumers will soon have access to nationwide health plans similar to those available to federal employees.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration said Friday that it would charge insurance companies for selling health insurance to millions of Americans in new online markets run by the federal government.

docs.lead_paragraph: Businesses like restaurants and hotels that rely heavily on low-income workers are trying to decide how to change their business models for the new health care law.

headline.seo: Small Employers Weigh Impact of Providing Health Insurance
headline.main: Small Employers Weigh Impact of Providing Health Insurance

docs.abstract: Smaller businesses like restaurants and hotels that rely heavily on low-income workers are trying to decide how to change their business models for the new federal health care law; health care experts say much confusion exists over what is highly complicated law.

docs.lead_paragraph: With fewer providers competing aggressively for health care business, doctors who sell their practices are feeling pressed to meet financial targets.

headline.seo: Doctors Who Work for Hospitals Face a New Bottom Line
headline.main: A Hospital War Reflects a Bind for  Doctors in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: A Hospital War Reflects A Bind for U.S. Doctors

docs.abstract: Doctors in Boise, Idaho, complain consolidation of the medical industry has given two hospitals too much power over the medical pipeline, allowing them to dictate which tests and procedures to perform, and how much to charge; issue reflects national problem, as doctors who have sold their practices and signed contracts with hospitals report growing pressure to meet financial goals at expense of quality care.
docs.snippet: With fewer providers competing aggressively for health care business, doctors who sell their practices are feeling pressed to meet financial targets.
